text:
Hi,

When I run make install, I get these outputs and then it fails:

make[3]: *** [install-modules-yes] Error 2
make[3]: Leaving directory `/home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/modules/aaa'
make[2]: *** [install-recursive] Error 1
make[2]: Leaving directory `/home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/modules/aaa'
make[1]: *** [install-recursive] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/modules'
make: *** [install-recursive] Error 1

I ran ./configure with these flags : 
--with-pcre=/home/guest/pcre-8.31/pcre-config 
--enable-module=so
--with-mpm=worker 
--enable-so 
--enable-layout=Apache 			  
--enable-mods-shared=most

The 'make' also successfully completed. 

Any help would be great

Thanks!
creator: dementor92337@gmail.com
dementor92337@gmail.com
text:
I noticed that all the errors relate to the libtool installing the different modules.

I also noticed that when I create the file before-hand in the /usr/local/apache2/modules/ directory, it works:

If I don't create a file and run the libtool:
root@httptest:/home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/modules/aaa> /home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/srclib/apr/libtool --mode=install install mod_allowmethods.la /usr/local/apache2/modules/
libtool: install: install .libs/mod_allowmethods.so /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.so
find: bad status-- /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.so
install: File mod_allowmethods.so was not found.

If I DO create a file and then run the libtool:

root@httptest:/home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/modules/aaa> touch /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.so

root@httptest:/home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/modules/aaa> ls -l /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.so
-rw-r--r--    1 root     system            0 Jul 30 17:21 /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.so

root@httptest:/home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/modules/aaa> /home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/srclib/apr/libtool --mode=install install mod_allowmethods.la /usr/local/apache2/modules/
libtool: install: install .libs/mod_allowmethods.so /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.so
File .libs/mod_allowmethods.so is installed as /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.so .
libtool: install: install .libs/mod_allowmethods.lai /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.la
find: bad status-- /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.la
install: File mod_allowmethods.lai was not found.

root@httptest:/home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/modules/aaa> ls -l /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.so
-rw-r--r--    1 root     system       105876 Jul 30 17:23 /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_allowmethods.so

The file size changes, and it has been created.

I notice that in the "make install", it removes all previous instances of the file:
rm -f /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_authz_groupfile.so
/home/guest/httpd-2.4.2/srclib/apr/libtool --silent --mode=install install mod_authz_groupfile.la /usr/local/apache2/modules/
find: bad status-- /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_authz_groupfile.so
install: File mod_authz_groupfile.so was not found.


If I knew where this line was in the installation files, I could edit that line to fix this problem.

If you can help me find it, then that would help as well.

creator: dementor92337@gmail.com
text:
Hey, I'm closing this bug report because I solved the problem.

Turns out that I needed to install GNU coreutils, because the AIX version of the "install" program was not working.

So whenever I ran "make install", it used the AIX version of "install". I needed to get the GNU Coreutils version of "install".

After getting that, the "make install" finished successfully.
